definitions.definition: a foot-operated lever or control for a vehicle, musical instrument, or other mechanism, in particular.
each of a pair of cranks used for powering a bicycle or other vehicle propelled by leg power.
a foot-operated throttle, brake, or clutch control in a motor vehicle.

each of a set of two or three levers on a piano, particularly (also sustaining pedal ) one that, when depressed by the foot, prevents the dampers from stopping the sound when the keys are released. The second is the soft pedal ; a third, if present, produces either selective sustaining or complete muffling of the tone.
each key of an organ keyboard that is played with the feet.
move by working the pedals of a bicycle.
examples: they pedaled along the canal towpath

definitions.definition: move (a bicycle) by working its pedals.
examples: she was pedaling a bicycle around town

definitions.definition: work the pedals of a bicycle.
examples: he was coming down the path on his bike, pedaling hard

definitions.definition: use the pedals of a piano, especially in a particular style.
examples: Chopin gave no indications of pedaling in his manuscript
